ĞĞ»Ğ°Ñ… ĞĞºĞ±Ğ°Ñ€! Ğ’Ğ¾Ñ‚ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ.)
well, there are two major arguments for altruism (being kind / helpful). 1.) Evolutionary: while being selfish appears to be more selfserving, the fact that the vast majority of people are at least somewhat inclined to help each other proves without doubt, that genes and  instinctual behavior survived a lot more than not. 2.) Logical: If you are kind and friendly to your surrounding, your surrounding is a lot more inclined to be helpful to you. That is how any living creature works, so its not even human psychology, but something a lot lot more basic.   Karma might be an illusive concept, but causality itself kinda picks up where our wishes for karma are lacking.

make at home: A clean 16-oz plastic soda bottle. 1/2 cup 20-volume hydrogen peroxide liquid (20-volume is a 6% solution; you can get this from a beauty supply store or hair salon) 1 Tablespoon (one packet) of dry yeast. 3 Tablespoons of warm water. Liquid dishwashing soap. Food coloring.

Awesome vid. It reminds me of something that happened a while back. I'm really into music and i wanted to play the banjo. I went into the music store here in my town and we were going to put the banjo on layaway. The guy at the counter asked when we could pay it off. I wasn't sure so i tried to call my mom (i was 16 at the time) and this other person there asked if i knew how to play. I said no but i was going to learn. We go back to doing our own thing and the guy goes up to the counter and says he wanted to buy the banjo. I was devastated because I thought he was just trying to be a jerk. I soon found out he bought it for me, and i was shocked. NOTHING had ever happened to me like that. it warms my heart that a complete stranger who was only in his 20s in fact, would spend almost 200$ on a stranger. We surely need more people like this in the world.

For those wondering, "50 times the force when pushing against a football" is about 0,9 bar (13 psi) per ball, so in total, roughly 45 bars, or 650 psi. That's equivalent to diving to about 450 meters (1 480 feet) deep in to water.

The absolute king of context. He could have spent A LOT less money and just tried to smash the record; but what kind of video would that have made? What kind of impact would it have made? The genius of Mark Rober is applying context to his records. It sounds a little heartless, but tying a story like this to your videos is what crushes the algorithm and keeps the conversation going. At the end of the day he gets a guarenteed viral hit AND he makes a massively positive impact on people's lives. Mark is a genius engineer, from the way he engineers his records, his videos, how he hits the algorithm, and his heartfelt positive impact to society. This is what all science should strive for.

If I had to guess based off the reaction of the devil's toothpaste he is using some sort of fluorine compound.  Just a guess though, if he is then that is probably why he isn't giving out the instructions with because it is one of the most reactive elements on the periodic table and many people have set themselves on fire experimenting with it. The M1911, also known as the Colt 1911, or the Colt Government, is a single-action, semi-automatic, magazine-fed, recoil-operated pistol chambered for the .45 ACP cartridge.[7] The pistol's formal designation as of 1940 was Automatic Pistol, Caliber .45, M1911 for the original model of 1911 or Automatic Pistol, Caliber .45, M1911A1 for the M1911A1, which was adopted in 1924. The designation changed to Pistol, Caliber .45, Automatic, M1911A1 in the Vietnam War era.[7]  United States Pistol, Caliber .45, M1911
